sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"出版物，定期刊物"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: magazine, journal, periodical, publication, newspaper, review, press
means: magazine ： 指刊登各种文章、小说、诗歌、评议的杂志。
journal ： 本义为"日报"，现在可指定期发生的周刊、月刊、季刊等或指学术团体出版的刊物、杂志或学报。
periodical ： 通常指除日报以外的定期出版刊物。
publication ： 指出版物，发行物。
newspaper ： 一般指每日出版的报纸。
review ： 多指登载评论性文章或讨论重大事件的文章的刊物。
press ： 系报刊总称，也指报界或报业。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"压，挤"之意。
means: press ： 普通用词，指一个物体在另一个物体上加压力。
jam ： 专指四面八方都压紧或塞满。
squeeze ： 多指从两面或多面施加压力来压紧、压碎或压出水来。
compress ： 指把某些东西压在一起或使占有较小空间。
squash ： 指某物受力被压偏或压碎。也指塞挤。

word_mean: 一种能使滑块作往复运动，并按所需方向给模具施加一定压力的机器。

sentence.Network_en: Politicians want a lap-dog press which will uncritically report their propaganda.
sentence.Network_cn: 政客们想要的是不问是非、甘为他们搞宣传的哈巴狗一样的新闻媒体。

sentence.Network_en: He faced the press, initially, in a somewhat subdued mood.
sentence.Network_cn: 他最初面对媒体时情绪有点忧郁。

sentence.Network_en: The government says it will not be bullied by the press.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府声称不会屈服于新闻媒体的压力。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)(of a celebrity or politician) greet people by shaking hands
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)（要人，政客）握手问候

jx.jx_en_mean: To shake hands and mingle with many people, especially while campaigning for public office.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 拥挤：握手并和许多人混在一起，尤指在竞选公职时

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French presse (noun), presser (verb), from Latin pressare 'keep pressing', frequentative of premere

late 16th cent.: alteration (by association with press) of obsolete prest 'pay given on enlistment, enlistment by such payment', from Old French prest 'loan, advance pay', based on Latin praestare 'provide'

entry.def: If you press something somewhere, you push it firmly against something else.

example.ex: He pressed his back against the door...
example.tran: 他后背紧紧靠在门上。

example.ex: They pressed the silver knife into the cake.
example.tran: 他们拿银制餐刀切入蛋糕。

entry.def: If you press a button or switch, you push it with your finger in order to make a machine or device work.

example.ex: Drago pressed a button and the door closed...
example.tran: 德拉戈按了一个按钮，然后门就关上了。

example.ex: There was no-one at the reception desk, so he pressed a bell for service.
example.tran: 接待处一个人也没有，于是他按了服务铃。

entry.tran: 用力按；用力挤压；用力踩
entry.def: If you press something or press down on it, you push hard against it with your foot or hand.

example.ex: The engine stalled. He pressed the accelerator hard...
example.tran: 发动机熄火了。他用力踩油门。

example.ex: She stood up and leaned forward with her hands pressing down on the desk.
example.tran: 她站起来，双手撑在桌子上，身体向前倾。

entry.def: If you press for something, you try hard to persuade someone to give it to you or to agree to it.

example.ex: Police might now press for changes in the law...
example.tran: 警方现在可能竭力要求修改法律。

example.ex: They had pressed for their children to be taught French.
example.tran: 他们极力要求给他们的孩子教授法语。

entry.def: If you press someone, you try hard to persuade them to do something.

example.ex: Trade unions are pressing him to stand firm...
example.tran: 各工会正在竭力劝说他坚定立场。

example.ex: Mr King seems certain to be pressed for further details...
example.tran: 看来人们一定会竭力要求金先生提供进一步的细节。

entry.def: If someone presses their claim, demand, or point, they state it in a very forceful way.

example.ex: The protest campaign has used mass strikes and demonstrations to press its demands...
example.tran: 抗议活动通过大规模罢工和示威游行来向当局提出诉求。

example.ex: His officials have visited Washington to press their case for economic aid.
example.tran: 他的官员们已经访问了华盛顿，竭力要求得到经济援助。

entry.def: If an unpleasant feeling or worry presses on you, it affects you very much or you are always thinking about it.

example.ex: The weight of irrational guilt pressed on her...
example.tran: 无端的负罪感压得她喘不过气来。

example.ex: Right now, I've got other problems that are pressing on me.
example.tran: 现在又有其他一些问题困扰着我。

entry.def: If you press something on someone, you give it to them and insist that they take it.

example.ex: All I had was money, which I pressed on her reluctant mother...
example.tran: 我就只有钱了，她母亲虽然不愿接受，我还是硬塞给了她。

example.ex: Food and cigarettes were pressed on him.
example.tran: 别人硬塞给他一些食品和香烟。

entry.def: If you press clothes, you iron them in order to get rid of the creases.

example.ex: Vera pressed his shirt...
example.tran: 薇拉把他的衬衫熨平了。

example.ex: There's a couple of dresses to be pressed.
example.tran: 还有几件衣服要熨。

entry.tran: 榨取，压榨，挤压（水果或蔬菜）
entry.def: If you press fruits or vegetables, you squeeze them or crush them, usually in order to extract the juice.

example.ex: The grapes are hand-picked and pressed...
example.tran: 这些葡萄是精心挑选用来榨汁的。

example.ex: I pressed the juice of half a lemon into a glass of water.
example.tran: 我用手将半个柠檬的汁挤入一杯水中。

entry.def: Newspapers are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Today the British press is full of articles on India's new prime minister...
example.tran: 今天英国的报纸上登满了关于印度新任总理的文章。

example.ex: ...freedom of the Press...
example.tran: 新闻自由

entry.def: Journalists are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Christie looked relaxed and calm as he faced the press afterwards...
example.tran: 后来面对记者的时候，克里斯蒂显得放松而镇静。

example.ex: A meeting was promised, but the Press was not admitted.
example.tran: 承诺将召开一次会议，但是不允许记者到场。

entry.def: A press or a printing press is a machine used for printing things such as books and newspapers.

example.ex: ...the invention of the printing press...
example.tran: 印刷机的发明

example.ex: He was writing the book up to the moment the presses rolled.
example.tran: 直到付梓的那一刻他才完稿。

entry.tran: （尤指在报纸、电视或广播上）受到批评/得到好评
entry.def: If someone or something gets a bad press, they are criticized, especially in the newspapers, on television, or on radio. If they get a good press, they are praised.

example.ex: ...the bad press that career women consistently get in this country...
example.tran: 该国职业女性一直受到的舆论上的苛评

example.ex: Men get more bad press in her new novel.
example.tran: 在她的新小说中，男人受到了更多的谴责。

entry.def: If you press charges against someone, you make an official accusation against them which has to be decided in a court of law.

example.ex: I could have pressed charges against him...
example.tran: 我本可以起诉他。

example.ex: Police have announced they will not be pressing charges.
example.tran: 警方已宣布不会提起诉讼。

entry.def: When a newspaper or magazine goes to press, it starts being printed.

example.ex: We check prices at the time of going to press...
example.tran: 我们会在付印的时候核对价格。

example.ex: As this column went to press, I learnt that the man had died.
example.tran: 当这个专栏开印的时候，我才知道那个人已经死了。

entry.def: To press someone or something into service means to use them temporarily for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The local bar has been pressed into service as a school...
example.tran: 当地的酒吧被暂时用作学校。

example.ex: Kenny had been pressed into service to guard the door.
example.tran: 肯尼被临时雇来看门。

means.word_mean: 2. the state of urgently demanding notice or attention;
3. the gathering and publishing of news in the form of newspapers or magazines
6. a tall piece of furniture that provides storage space for clothes; has a door and rails or hooks for hanging clothes
7. clamp to prevent wooden rackets from warping when not in use
8. any machine that exerts pressure to form or shape or cut materials or extract liquids or compress solids
9. a weightlift in which the barbell is lifted to shoulder height and then smoothly lifted overhead
10. the act of pressing; the exertion of pressure;

sentences.sentence: "he used pressure to stop the bleeding"

means.word_mean: 1. exert pressure or force to or upon;
2. force or impel in an indicated direction;

sentences.sentence: "I urged him to finish his studies"
"weigh heavily on the mind", "Something pressed on his mind"

means.word_mean: 4. place between two surfaces and apply weight or pressure;

sentences.sentence: "Press little holes into the soft clay"

means.word_mean: 9. exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person; be an advocate for;

sentences.sentence: "The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate"

means.word_mean: 11. make strenuous pushing movements during birth to expel the baby;

sentences.sentence: "`Now push hard,' said the doctor to the woman"
"The prophet bid all people to become good persons"

list.explanation: 抓…当兵，强征…入伍，强迫或诱劝…参加或做(某事)

example.en: The voters were press-ganged to the polls.
example.zh: 选民们被动员去参加投票了。

auth_sentence.content: Mairead Philpott did not speak during the press conference.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mairead Philpott did not speak during the press conference.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mairead Philpott did not speak during the press conference.

auth_sentence.content: Press together the edges of the pastry to seal.
auth_sentence.res_content: Press together the edges of the pastry to seal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Press together the edges of the pastry to seal.

auth_sentence.content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可压缩的, 可压榨的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compress[v.压缩]+ible能……的→adj.可压缩的, 可压榨的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depress[v.压制,压抑]+ed……的→adj.沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给人深刻印象的,感人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: impress印象,引人注目+ive……的→adj.给人深刻印象的,感人的
press挤压+ing……的→adj.急迫的
compress[v.压缩]+ion表名词→n.压缩,压紧,浓缩
depress[v.压制,压抑]+ion表名词→n.消沉;不景气萧条期
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
stems_affixes.word_buile: express表达,表示+ion→n.表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
impress印象,引人注目+ion表名词→n.印象,感想;盖印,压痕
oppress[v.压迫,压制]+ion表名词→n.压迫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
stems_affixes.word_buile: press挤压+ure表名词→n.压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
suppress[v.镇压,压制]+ion表名词→n.镇压,压制
press挤压→n.&n.&v.压, 按
com一起+press压→一起压→压缩
de向下+press压→向下压→压制→情绪低下
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达
im进+press挤压→压进去→盖印→印入头脑→留下印象
op加强动作+press挤压→拼命压→压迫
re回+press挤压→压回去
sup下+press压→压下去

Sentence.sentence: In a press release describing the report, Mr. Annan stressed the need for the negotiations to focus on increasing the flow of money from rich to poor regions to help reduce their vulnerability to climate hazards while still curbing the emissions of the heat-trapping gases.
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men
More and more Americans feel pressed for time nowadays
The perpetual argument is that funds are tight, that we have more pressing problems here on Earth.

sentences.en: Give the button a slight press and the music would die.
sentences.cn: 把按钮轻轻一按, 音乐就会停止。

sentences.en: This type of press can feed out papers much faster than ordinary one.
sentences.cn: 这种印刷机印刷报纸比普通印刷机快得多。

means.word_mean: [总称]新闻，杂志；从事印刷业者；新闻界；出版界；通讯社；新闻记者

sentences.en: The press are[is] interested in sports.
sentences.cn: 新闻界对体育运动感兴趣。

sentences.en: Press the button, then the machine will work.
sentences.cn: 按下电钮, 机器就能转动了。

sentences.en: The man was pressed to pay off his debt.
The little girl pressed her nose against the shop window.
sentences.cn: 小女孩把她的鼻子紧贴在商店橱窗上。

sentences.en: He pressed his way through the crowd.
They are pressing us to make a quick decision.
sentences.cn: 他们正在敦促我们迅速做出决定。

sentences.en: He is still pressing his claim for compensation.
I'm very pressed for cash at the moment.
The police tried hard to press the crowd back.
sentences.cn: 警察拼命把人群往后赶。

sentences.en: The government was looking for a chance to press its economic programme.
sentences.cn: 政府正在寻找机会推行其经济方案。
行人们在人行道上熙熙攘攘走去。

sentences.en: pressing for eight planes rather than six
sentences.cn: 竭力要求八架飞机而不是六架

sentences.en: The girl pressed close to her mother.
sentences.cn: 小女孩紧紧地挤在母亲身边。

sentences.en: Since air has weight, it must press down on the surface of the earth.
sentences.cn: 既然空气有重量，它就必定压向地球的表面。
这件丝绸连衣裙很容易烫平。

jushi.english: We can either make camp now, or press ahead until dark and be that much nearer our objective.
jushi.chinese: 我们要么现在扎营,要么在天黑前加紧行动,更接近我们的目标。
